page.title: 01INTRODUCTION TO 04040198.
page.content: Our survey area is predominantly agricultural. It is transversed from the North West corner to the South East by the A419 Trunk road which links Cirencester to Swindon. All other roads in the area of the survey are unclassified. By far the largest feature in our area is the Army camp at South Cerney. Apart from this, there are three small villages, Preston, Harnhill and Driffield. The land surrounding these villages is all farmed, and thus our survey concentrated on these aspects of life in 1985; life and farming in the villages, and the role of the Army camp at South Cerney.
